definition: to depend on/to hang on in a place/bad/to renege (on promise)/to disclaim/to rat (on debts)/rascally/to blame/to put the blame on

sentences.english: Up to then, she had managed pretty well.
sentences.chinese: 在此之前，她还过得不赖。

sentences.english: Not bad for a small Japanese import.
sentences.chinese: 这一小宗日本进口货还真不赖。

sentences.english: The car is not bad in appearance.
sentences.chinese: 这辆小车外表看起来还不赖。

sentences.english: As a crass american you do a good job .
sentences.chinese: 作为一个地道的美国人你干得真不赖。
听起来还满不赖的，低音效果不错。

sentences.english: "Do you want to come to tahiti with me?"That would be spiffy. "
sentences.chinese: 你想和我一起去塔希提岛吗？“那可真不赖。

sentences.english: It tastes so good, especially the peanut butter cups.
sentences.chinese: 味道真不赖，特别是那些花生酱牛油饼。

sentences.english: Leading a dog s life in America isn t such a bad thing.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，狗过的日子还是蛮不赖的。

sentences.english: The night we went to Bannockburn by way of Brighton Pier.
sentences.chinese: 是夜去班诺克本我们经由不赖顿码头。

definition: (dialect) not that great/not up to much/nothing special
not up to much/very indifferent/nothing great about it/nothing good to be said about it
see 沒說的|没说的[mei2 shuo1 de5]
to have real skill/to know one's stuff
to be underwhelmed/to be less than impressed
to have a skill/to have a lot on the ball/to have an affair
lit. can pass through (an opening)/fig. can get by (in life)/tolerably well/not too bad/How are you getting by?/How's life?
acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
